header_summary:
VigSeth introduces the Twinstor Blockchain project, focusing on developing a new Layer 1 protocol leveraging the Proof of Useful Work consensus mechanism for enhancing digital twin technologies across several industries. The project aims for a transaction throughput of over 1000 TPS and positions itself as a practical tool beyond current AI trends, with a domain already secured and a comprehensive whitepaper available for potential collaborators at [Twinstor Blockchain Whitepaper](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Xqfk99fbXz5ZSGiVSHeVhJi1bEUgCWuU/view?usp=sharing).

Niftynei discusses the integration of a universal sighash mode into Simplicity, a blockchain programming language, to enhance security and flexibility by allowing custom signature hashes. This integration requires significant modification and careful planning to ensure the accurate inclusion of necessary data, promising to open new avenues for blockchain applications through customizable transaction verification processes. The endeavor highlights ongoing efforts to improve blockchain's security, efficiency, and versatility as detailed at [Simplicity and Universal Sighash](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/writing-simplicity-programs-with-simplicityhl/1900/4).

Sanket1729 brings to light a technology that surpasses Jeremy Rubin's development for CTV, involving Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) to enhance security or trust in computational processes. The discussion indicates a readiness or potential for practical implementation, emphasizing the technology's relevance and applicability in current systems or platforms, and suggesting its deployment and operational aspects are of significant interest at [Confidential Script Emulate Soft Forks Using Stateless TEEs](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/confidential-script-emulate-soft-forks-using-stateless-tees/1918/2).

recent_posts.title: New paper on Proof of Usable Work
recent_posts.summary:
- The collaboration focuses on a new L1 protocol using PoUW for better scalability.
- "Twinstor Blockchain" aims to revolutionize digital twin tech across key industries.
- Domain twinstor.xyz established, inviting stakeholders to contribute and review the whitepaper.

recent_posts.title: Writing Simplicity Programs with SimplicityHL
recent_posts.summary:
- Integrating a universal sighash mode into Simplicity could enhance security and flexibility.
- This feature requires careful planning and significant coding and testing efforts for successful implementation.
- It promises new possibilities for blockchain applications by allowing more control over transaction verification.

recent_posts.title: Confidential Script: Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
recent_posts.summary:
- The technology is seen as an improvement on Jeremy Rubin's CTV work.
- It suggests TEEs enhance security in computational processes.
- Interest in its deployment status signifies its potential readiness for real-world application.

today_in_history_posts.title: Selfish Mining Prevention
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Selfish mining involves colluding miners mining at a lower hashrate to gain advantage.
- A proposed solution adjusts block rewards based on peak hashrate to discourage this.
- Addressing future challenges includes combining it with a dynamic difficulty algorithm and fee market adjustments.

today_in_history_posts.title: Measuring centrality of nodes in LN graph
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Kulpreet explores measuring node centrality in the Lightning Network for better routing and stability.
- He uses methods from Freeman and Tarjan's research to measure node importance and network structure.
- Seeking feedback, he shares initial findings and analytical methods in a Medium post.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies split into passive (low-engagement) and active (high-engagement) types.
- Passive investing's downsides include asset underutilization and societal impacts like less affordable housing.
- The blog outlines a theoretical system where central banks use deflationary currencies like Bitcoin to stabilize economies.
